title: [BEAM-13590] Renaming collections.Iterable to collections.abc.Iterable.
body:
In Python 3.10, the symbols under collections.abc.* are removed from collections.*.
They have been deprecated since 3.3.

(There may be other collections.abc to be replaced as well but this allows me to run some of the examples.)

title: [BEAM-13430] Re-enable dependency analysis for java modules.
body:
The upgrade to gradle 7.x caused the migration from 'provided' scope to 'compileOnly' which required more dependencies to be flagged as 'permitUnusedDeclared' as they aren't all necessary for compilation but are necessary for pom.xml generation. This change also include the migration from hamcrest_core and hamcrest_library to hamcrest since the single package now supersedes it which the dependency analsyis plugin picked up on. Finally, I also removed a usage of guava within the Dataflow worker code and now depend only on the shaded version of guava within that codebase. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: Update venv creation commands in release scripts.
body:
Changes:

- Prepend venv dir path with ./ where applicable when sourcing activation script (sourcing silently failed for me on some Ubuntu versions without this) 
- Install `wheel` when we create venv (necessary follow up for https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/15819), otherwise Beam fails to install from sources. BEAM-8954 would be a cleaner solution.)
- Misc wording updates & corrections in release guide.
- Driveby fixes for similar changes outside of release scripts.
- Another drive-by fix: Retry pip installs in scripts that might be running periodically on Jenkins to reduce flakiness.

title: [BEAM-13577] Beam Select's uniquifyNames function loses nullability of Complex types while inferring schema
body:
We use BeamSQL in our project. When we use any JOIN. SQL generates BeamCoGBKJoinRel plan which uses Select from core sdk. While Select infer output schema it loses nullability of complex types such as Array, Map. I added Test cases to catch error and also fix on Select's uniquifyNames function. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13578] Validate that repeatable PipelineOptions need to be specified as a list if set programmatically
body:
Make it clear that repeatable PipelineOptions like dataflow_service_options or experiments need to be specified as a list if set programmatically (example in [documentation](https://cloud.google.com/dataflow/docs/guides/setting-pipeline-options#setting_required_options)), so users do not inadvertently specify it as a string, to mirror the way they are set via the command line, e.g. These will not work, and will throw an error ``` beam_options = PipelineOptions( ... experiments='use_runner_v2', dataflow_service_options='enable_prime') ``` These will work ``` beam_options = PipelineOptions( experiments=['use_runner_v2'], dataflow_service_options=['enable_prime']) ``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13009] Fix tests to ensure absence of duplicates only per request
body:
The checks in previous tests were too strict and refused duplicates globally. However, deduplication is only per request to prevent API validation errors. When running tests with low `targetParellelism` global duplicates may appear due to bundle sizes >= 25 (DynamoDB batch size). See details here https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-13009 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: Fix default type inference of CombinePerKey.
body:
More typehints propagation of CombinePerKey, MapTuple, FlatMapTuple get_type_hints returns an empty TypeHint object. Add with_default to initialize the typehints from the fn when the hints are generated. [default_type_hints() and in the map functions] In MapTuple and FlatMapTuple, the input type hint is still ignored. This is because IOTypeHints cannot distinguish *args from an ordinary argument. I feel there can be more complications even if this one is tracked. For CombinePerKey, also override infer_output_types() to perform an inference pass on the fn. This is more accurate than the default types. There is some redundancy with default_type_hints() Also fix strip_output_annotations (bug discovered while fixing the broken users from the above changes) It needs to inspect into the composites (Tuples etc), but wasn't doing so. For now we return Any if any inner hint of a composite is annotated. Expanded the comment. This shall be filed / synced as https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/16351 BUG=36682198 CL=418042595 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12830] Install go version w/host platform.
body:
Fix container builds when the user isn't on a linux-amd64 platform. Resolves an issue such as: ``` > Task :sdks:java:container:goBuild System Go installation: /usr/local/go/bin/go is go version go1.17.5 darwin/amd64; Preparing to use /Users/dpcollins/go/bin/go1.16.12 go install: cannot install cross-compiled binaries when GOBIN is set > Task :sdks:java:container:goBuild FAILED ``` where go objects to "installing" to GoBin in a cross compiled fashion. We always want the Go version to be installed with the host architecture. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: Fix allowedSkew log line to properly print large skews
body:

title: Benchmark and optimize Python RowCoder
body:

title: [BEAM-12865] Fix triggering_frequency validation
body:
I noticed that the change that I added in https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/15489 included a bug that will make the transform raise an error when `triggering_frequency` is used with file loads and `with_auto_sharding=None`. This PR moves the check inside a branch only executed when the method is `WriteToBigQuery.Method.STREAMING_INSERTS`. That's when we want to make sure `with_auto_sharding=True` when `triggering_frequency` is defined. @pabloem sorry about that `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------
